paper_reference: Logic Error Localization and Correction with Machine Learning (Xu et al., AAAI 2023)

categories.name: Loop Condition
categories.description: Incorrect loops in the for/while condition
examples: Wrong loop initialization (e.g., i=1 instead of i=0)
Wrong loop termination condition (e.g., i<n instead of i<=n)
Wrong loop increment/decrement (e.g., i++ instead of i+=2)
Infinite loop due to wrong condition

categories.name: Condition Branch
categories.description: Incorrect expression in the if condition
examples: Wrong logical operator (AND instead of OR)
Missing or extra condition in if/else

categories.name: Statement Integrity
categories.description: Statement lacks a part of logical structure

categories.name: Output/Input Format
categories.description: Incorrect cin/cout statement (or print/input in Python)

categories.name: Variable Initialization
categories.description: Incorrect declaration or initialization of variables
examples: Wrong initial value (e.g., sum=1 instead of sum=0)

categories.name: Computation
categories.description: Incorrect basic math symbols or calculations
examples: Wrong operator (+ instead of -, * instead of /)

instructions_for_models: You are analyzing code with logical errors. Based on the buggy code, problem description, and execution feedback (if available), classify the PRIMARY logical error into ONE of the 7 categories above. Return ONLY the category code (e.g., 'LOOP_COND', 'COND_BRANCH', etc.). If multiple errors exist, choose the most significant one.
